items.content_html:
iPadOS 17 now supports UVC (USB Video Class) devices, allowing iPads to recognize external webcams, cameras, and other devices connected over USB-C. Federico Viticci tested this feature and found that he could use a Game Boy Camera as his iPad Pro's webcam during FaceTime calls. He also experimented with using a game capture card to play Nintendo Switch and Steam Deck games on his iPad's display. This unexpected functionality showcases the versatility of iPadOS 17 and its potential for creative and gaming applications.

17 Points | 4 comments
items.title: I used a Game Boy camera for Facetime video calls in iPadOS 17 (www.macstories.net)
items.summary: 'I Used a Game Boy Camera for FaceTime Video Calls in iPadOS 17 and It Was Glorious'

items.content_html:
A script was created to ask prompts testing reasoning, instruction following, and creativity to around 60 models. The answers were stored in a SQLite database. The prompts covered various topics such as arguing for and against the use of Kubernetes, explaining quantum field theory to a high-school student, and finding the next 20 leap years. The script used a mix of APIs from different platforms. The creator plans to improve the script by using better stop sequences and prompt formatting tailored to each model.

359 Points | 219 comments
items.title: Asking 60 LLMs a set of 20 questions (benchmarks.llmonitor.com)
items.summary: 'Script Tests Reasoning and Creativity of 60+ Models Using Prompts'

items.content_html:
view.py is a lightning-fast, modern web framework that is currently in a high alpha stage of development. It requires CPython 3.8+ for installation. The framework offers a simple and efficient way to build web applications. It is actively seeking new contributors and provides installation instructions for Linux/macOS and Windows. view.py aims to provide a fast and modern solution for web development.

76 Points | 33 comments
items.title: Show HN: I built a Python web framework (github.com)
items.summary: 'view.py: A Lightning-Fast and Modern Web Framework in Alpha Stage'

items.content_html:
LEGO uses a variety of plastics for their bricks, including CA, HIPS, Bakelite, ABS, SAN, PP, PC, MABS, PA, POM, TP, PE, MTPO, TPU, SEBS, and PET. Each plastic has its own properties and uses, with ABS being the most commonly used since 1963. LEGO is also investing in developing sustainable materials and has already started using plant-sourced polyethylene and phasing out plastic shopping bags.

266 Points | 87 comments
items.title: Every type of plastic used by LEGO (2022) (bricknerd.com)
items.summary: The Many Types of Plastic Used By LEGO

items.content_html:
John Le Carré's Cornwall home, Tregiffian Cottage, is up for sale for $3.7 million. The 5,000-square-foot house, where Le Carré wrote many of his novels, features a detached writing studio, a library with bespoke joinery, and a safe room. The property offers stunning views and a picturesque setting. Le Carré's son, Nick Cornwell, described the cottage as a place filled with wildlife and natural beauty, making it an ideal space for rest, work, or self-reflection.

26 Points | 23 comments
items.title: English cottage where John le Carré wrote Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy is for sale (lithub.com)
items.summary: 'John Le Carré's Cornwall Home, Tregiffian Cottage, Hits the Market for $3.7 Million'

items.content_html:
Humans possess a unique ability to recognize and remember sequential information, according to a study. Bonobos, our closest relatives, struggle to learn the order of stimuli in the same way as humans. This finding sheds light on the cognitive distinctions between humans and other animals, explaining why only humans possess certain cultural abilities like language and advanced planning. Sequential memory may be the foundational block behind many uniquely human behaviors and capabilities.

13 Points | 15 comments
items.title: Sequential Memory Is a Unique Human Trait (neurosciencenews.com)
items.summary: Sequential Memory Is a Unique Human Trait

items.content_html:
Freshpaint is a Customer Data Platform that helps businesses collect and integrate customer data. They offer a PHI Management Platform for healthcare providers and a Customer Data Platform for teams to collect and activate customer data. The company is fully remote and values freedom and ownership in work. They are backed by leading investors and have a deep analytics and growth experienced team. The role of Software Engineer at Freshpaint involves scaling infrastructure, designing new data processing systems, and building user experiences.

1 Points | 0 comments
items.title: Freshpaint (YC S19) is hiring engineers to build a HIPAA compliant data platform (jobs.ashbyhq.com)
items.summary: Freshpaint: Simplifying Customer Data Collection and Integration

items.content_html:
PAROL6 is a high-performance 3D-printed desktop robotic arm that aims to mimic industrial robots in terms of design and usability. The control software, GUI, and STL files are open-source, allowing users to build their own PAROL6 robot by following the provided instructions. The project welcomes donations, advice, and contributions to support its open-source nature. The code and STL files are under the GPLv3 License.

101 Points | 22 comments
items.title: PAROL6 Desktop Robot Arm (github.com)
items.summary: 'PAROL6: A High-Performance 3D-Printed Desktop Robotic Arm with Open-Source Design'

items.content_html:
Dennis Austin, the principal software developer of PowerPoint, has passed away at the age of 76. Austin played a significant role in shaping how information is communicated in modern society through the development of PowerPoint. The software, which was released in 1987, revolutionized the creation of slides and became a ubiquitous tool in offices, classrooms, and government agencies. Despite its widespread use, PowerPoint has also faced criticism for its potential to create mind-numbing presentations filled with bullet points. Austin's contributions to the software were instrumental in its success.

43 Points | 107 comments
items.title: Dennis Austin, developer of PowerPoint, has died (www.washingtonpost.com)
items.summary: 'Dennis Austin, Principal Software Developer of PowerPoint, Dies at 76'

items.content_html:
In 1804, thirteen-year-old actor William Henry West Betty became a sensation in London, with crowds mobbing theaters and camped outside his home. This article explores the phenomenon of Bettymania and how it was carefully orchestrated through paid critics, merchandise, and strategic audience placement. While some critics saw it as a national embarrassment, Betty's fame and fee skyrocketed, but he eventually faded from the public eye. This story sheds light on the early history of celebrity culture and the fleeting nature of child stardom.

9 Points | 1 comments
items.title: A Teen Celebrity in 1804 (daily.jstor.org)
items.summary: 'A Teen Celebrity in 1804: The Phenomenon of Bettymania and the Fleeting Nature of Child Stardom'

items.content_html:
This patch for FFmpeg's proresdec2 fixes and ports the cached reader. The changes include moving back to the regular get_bits API, reducing the lookup to switch the coding method, and using shorter reads for the end of the bitstream. The patch also provides speedup results for Win64 and Win32 platforms. The cached reader version shows a 20% speedup on Win64 and a 14% speedup on Win32.

17 Points | 0 comments
items.title: FFmpeg Patches for a 20% speedup of Apple ProRes decoding (ffmpeg.org)
items.summary: 'FFmpeg' Patch Improves Proresdec2 Performance with Cached Reader

items.content_html:
Wong Kar Wai's 2000 film 'In the Mood for Love' has had a significant influence on popular culture, with its unique aesthetic and storytelling. The film, set in 1960s Hong Kong, follows two individuals who discover that their spouses are having an affair and become entangled themselves. Wong's personal history and diverse influences shaped the film's style, which combines elements of French New Wave filmmaking, American mystery, and Chinese literature. 'In the Mood for Love' is a visually stunning and emotionally resonant work that continues to captivate audiences.

9 Points | 0 comments
items.title: The era-defining aesthetic of “In the Mood for Love” (www.newyorker.com)
items.summary: 'In the Mood for Love': Wong Kar Wai's Influential Masterpiece

items.content_html:
SmartKnob is an open-source input device with software-configurable endstops and virtual detents. It uses a brushless gimbal motor paired with a magnetic encoder for closed-loop torque feedback control. The device is not yet recommended for general use due to potential mechanical and electrical revisions. The project is under active development and encourages community participation.

18 Points | 1 comments
items.title: SmartKnob – Haptic input knob with software-defined endstops and virtual detents (github.com)
items.summary: SmartKnob: An Open-Source Input Device with Software-Configurable Endstops and Virtual Detents

items.content_html:
Daniel Robbins shares his Linux journey, from becoming a Stampede Linux developer to starting his own distribution called Enoch. He emphasizes the potential of Linux to change, improve, and break things, as well as the importance of the Linux community. Robbins also discusses his experience dealing with difficult developers and offers advice on managing them.

19 Points | 1 comments
items.title: Birth of the Gentoo Linux Distribution (www.funtoo.org)
items.summary: 'The Potential of Linux and Dealing with Difficult Developers: Daniel Robbins' Linux Journey'

items.content_html:
The author argues that the sentiment in the Rust community that async/await is only useful for a small number of programs is misguided. They believe that actively shying away from async is the wrong approach and that many Rust projects are already using async/await without realizing it. The author also addresses the reasons why some people may not like async, such as poor advertising and standard library support. They conclude by encouraging Rustaceans to embrace async/await and explore its benefits.

90 Points | 74 comments
items.title: Why you might want async in your project (notgull.net)
items.summary: 'Why you might actually want async in your project'

items.content_html:
This repository is a fork of the facebookresearch/llama-recipes, adapted to fine-tune a Llama 7b chat model to replicate your personal WhatsApp texting style. The fine-tuned Llama model picked up on the user's texting nuances rapidly and accurately replicated common phrases and emoji usage. In a Turing Test with friends, the model fooled 10% of them, with some responses being eerily similar to the user's own. The adaptation of the Llama model offers a fun way to see how well a LLM can mimic your personal texting style.

51 Points | 12 comments
items.title: Show HN: WhatsApp-Llama: A clone of yourself from your WhatsApp conversations (github.com)
items.summary: Fine-tune Llama 7b to Mimic Your WhatsApp Style

items.content_html:
The author proposes a theory that even if a simulation of reality is never run, it would still feel real to the actors inside it. This theory is based on the idea that all possible states of a complex system already exist, and calculating them is not necessary for them to feel conscious. The author acknowledges that this theory does not negate the existence of choice and plans to explore community in NYC in future posts.

24 Points | 26 comments
items.title: Existing in an Un-Simulated Reality (iahwrites.substack.com)
items.summary: 'Existence in an Un-Simulated Reality: A Theory on the Feeling of Consciousness'

items.content_html:
Intel has announced that it has made an investment in Arm Holdings, joining the list of Arm's anchor investors. The head of Intel's foundry business unit confirmed that the investment was made because Arm's technology is strategically important for both Intel Foundry Services and Altera FPGA unit. Intel recognizes the importance of Arm's instruction set architecture (ISA) in a wide range of applications and aims to collaborate further with Arm in the future.

119 Points | 58 comments
items.title: Intel announces Arm investment, talks up RISC-V (www.tomshardware.com)
items.summary: Intel Invests in Arm Holdings, Recognizing the Importance of Arm's Technology

items.content_html:
Public restrooms are hard to find in America, with only eight public toilets for every 100,000 people. This poses a problem for millions of Americans suffering from medical conditions, as well as unhoused individuals, older adults, and pregnant individuals. The lack of accessible public restrooms can lead to anxiety and avoidance of going out. This article highlights the importance of addressing this issue for the well-being of various populations.

162 Points | 341 comments
items.title: Public restrooms are hard to find in America (www.washingtonpost.com)
items.summary: 'The Problem of Inaccessible Public Restrooms in America'

items.content_html:
This session at ICFP 2023 will discuss Eio 1.0, an effects-based IO stack for OCaml 5. The talk will cover its main features, including multi-core support, lock-free data structures, modular programming, interoperability with other concurrency libraries, and interactive monitoring support. The speakers will also share their experiences in porting existing applications to Eio.

7 Points | 0 comments
items.title: Eio 1.0 – Effects-based IO for OCaml 5 (icfp23.sigplan.org)
items.summary: 'Eio 1.0 - Effects-based IO for OCaml 5' to be Presented at ICFP 2023

The author shares their experience of running a Kubernetes cluster on a mix of virtual and bare metal machines with Hetzner. They decide to rebuild the cluster from scratch and document the process in a series of blog posts. The first part covers provisioning the first server, installing Talos Linux, and configuration and bootstrapping.

163 Points | 57 comments

items.summary: Building a Kubernetes Cluster with Talos on Hetzner: Part I

items.content_html:
Canadian housing prices have continued to rise at an alarming rate, with a 142% increase since 2005 on a real basis. This is in stark contrast to the U.S. housing market, which has seen a more modest 26% increase over the same period. The differences between the two markets become even more pronounced when comparing housing price gains to disposable income gains. While U.S. incomes have kept pace with housing prices, Canadian incomes have not, leading to a significant affordability issue in Canada.

158 Points | 371 comments
items.title: The U.S. housing market vs. the Canadian housing market (awealthofcommonsense.com)
items.summary: Canadian Housing Prices Continue to Soar, Outpacing U.S. Market

items.content_html:
Telescript is an agent-oriented programming language developed by General Magic as part of the Magic Cap system. It allowed end-user devices to upload programs to servers and take advantage of their capabilities. However, General Magic failed to find a niche in the market and Telescript services were eventually deprecated. The language was object-oriented and used a modified C-like syntax. It introduced the concepts of agents and places, which interacted with each other to perform tasks.

32 Points | 17 comments
items.title: Telescript (programming language) (en.wikipedia.org)
items.summary: 'Telescript: An Agent-Oriented Programming Language for Uploading Programs to Servers'

items.content_html:
When shifting a register by more than its size, different processor architectures exhibit different behaviors. The table provided in the article shows the behavior of various processors, including the 8086, Alpha AXP, x86-64, MIPS, PowerPC, and more. The article also mentions that the C and C++ languages leave the behavior undefined when shifting by more than the bit width of the shifted type.

78 Points | 52 comments
items.title: What happens when you shift a register by more than the register size? (devblogs.microsoft.com)
items.summary: Different Processor Architectures Behave Differently When Shifting Registers
